An **igniter**, @, is a [Flame mage](/wiki/Flame_mage "Flame mage") [quest guardian](/wiki/Quest_guardian "Quest guardian") in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"), and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"). They are identical to [frosters](/wiki/Froster "Froster"), the [Ice mage](/wiki/Ice_mage "Ice mage") quest guardians. Strangely, they lack [fire resistance](/wiki/Fire_resistance "Fire resistance"), but possess [poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance").

Eating an igniter's [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") or [tin](/wiki/Tin "Tin") has a 1⁄3 chance of conveying poison resistance, though killing one solely to do so is a [Bad Idea](/wiki/Bad_Idea "Bad Idea").

## Generation

Seven igniters are generated in the home level of the [Flame mage quest](/wiki/Flame_mage_quest "Flame mage quest") upon level creation, with five stationed in the "audience chamber" of the [High Flame Mage](/wiki/High_Flame_Mage "High Flame Mage")'s dwelling while the other two are placed randomly.

A igniter:

  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • is omnivorous.
  • is not a valid polymorphable form.
  • is a human.
  • is normally generated peaceful.
  • is strong.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • can be seen through infravision.
  • hits creatures as a +1 weapon.
Reference SLASH'EM_0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line5313

Eating an igniter's corpse or tin has a 1⁄3 chance of conveying poison resistance, though killing one solely to do so is a Bad Idea.

Generation

Seven igniters are generated in the home level of the Flame mage quest upon level creation, with five stationed in the "audience chamber" of the High Flame Mage's dwelling while the other two are placed randomly.
